IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO ENCOURAGE AN APPRECIATION FOR THE WORLD'S WILDLIFE AND HELP CONSERVE IT FOR FUTURE GENERATIONS.
IRS990.Description: The organization provided educational programs, assisted in zoo operations, provided capital support to the zoo, and recruited memberships to lend support to the zoo's operations. The Organization served approximately 551,000 people in the community for the year ended September 30, 2010.

OtherLiabilities.Description: FUNDS HELD ON BEHALF OF ZOO MIAMI

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: On October 1, 2009, the Society adopted the provisions of an accounting standard, which clarifies the accounting for uncertainty in income taxes recognized in an organization'S financial statements in accordance with existing accounting guidance on income taxes, and prescribes a recognition threshold and measurement process for financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return. This standard also provides guidance on derecognition, classification, interest and penalties, accounting in interim periods, disclosure and transition. Interest and penalties on tax liabilities, if any, would be recorded as an expense in the Statements of Activities. No liability for unrecognized tax benefits was recorded as a result of implementing this standard.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 6
Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: Members have no voting or other rights with respect to any aspect of the Organization. ONLY THE MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAVE VOTING RIGHTS IN THE ORGANIZATION, WITH EACH BOARD MEMBER BEING ENTITLED TO ONE VOTE. IN ADDITION, THE EXECUTIVE director and president of Zoo Miami IS A VOTING MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7b
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: The Board of Directors shall have (1) general power to manage and control the activities, affairs and property of the Organization,(2) total power, by majority vote, to adopt rules and regulations governing the actions of the Board, and (3) full and complete authority with respect to the distribution and payment of monies received by the Organization.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: A draft of the Form 990 was prepared by the independent accountant. The draft was presented to the Board of Directors and a copy was mailed to each director for review and approval.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH BOARD MEMBER IS ASKED ANNUALLY AT a board meeting IF THEY HAVE AN INTEREST THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO A CONFLICT.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR COMPENSATION IS DETERMINED AND APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OR COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. Same process is applied to determining the compensation for officers and key employees.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST. AN INTERESTED PERSON MAY CONTACT THE ORGANIZATION VIA PHONE OR SEND A LETTER REQUESTING SUCH INFORMATION. Additionally, the audited financial statements are available on the organization's website.

The process for oversight of the audit of the financial statements and selection of the independent accountant has not changed from prior year. the board of directors is responsible for such activities.

NameOfRelatedOrg.BusinessNameLine1: Zoo Miami (formerly known as Metro Zoo)

Form990ScheduleRPartIV.PrimaryActivity: Zoological Society raises funds to support the Zoo.
